title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: George B. Carse to Orlando Brown, October 11, 1866
summary: Carse updates Brown on the murder case of Patrick Thompson and the escape of his killer, J. C. Johnson, about which he originally notified authorities from Staunton. According the the October 16 Stauton Spectator, Johnson escaped from Lexington to Augusta County, where he was arrested in Fishersville.
keywords: Violence/Crime, Race Relations, Women, Community Values/Local Behavior, American Civil War
